content.raw:
Maybe? To be honest I’m still getting used to the more subtle points of Qt programming so I’m not exactly sure what you mean. What other model would I share in? Right now I am assuming the enum strings are the actual data that is needed by the device. Note that because front\_panel\_settings needs a number value but the actual settings are strings I need to keep track of both the index and the associated text. 

I’m also still debating how much of the index to expose to the user since many enum-like settings for devices often use the index as the programming value so it might be nice for the enum output to reflect the same index values as well. I didn’t find a great way to allow for that on my first pass but I hope to revisit it soon.
